abstracts.cdata!:
The results of the project are mixed.
            The transmission and distribution components were completed
            ahead of time and under budget. The main component, the
            Phase IV extension of Koyna, will be completed late in
            FY1999. But the underlying developmental outcome to
            strengthen the state electricity board was only marginally
            successful and is unlikely to be sustained. Key lessons
            learned were: The project did not produce operational and
            financial improvements in Maharashtra's power sector.
            It has become clear that a sustainable solution to the
            sector's problems requires focusing on restructuring
            the state power sector rather than revitalizing the state
            electricity boards (SEBs) as attempted in the past. This
            restructuring includes, inter alia, the unbundling of
            monopoly utilities, corporatization, establishment of an
            independent regulatory commission, tariff reforms, and
            privatization of distribution. This lesson has been applied
            in the ongoing power sector reform projects in Orissa,
            Haryana, and Andhra Pradesh. Projects must be carefully and
            adequately prepared, including the evaluation of risks that
            might cause delays, with an implementation team in place
            prior to loan approval, with bidding documents prepared and
            preferably issued and bids received; these are prerequisites
            if projects are to move smoothly from preparation to the
            implementation phase, with minimum delays to project
            completion. Resettlement issues must be dealt with during
            project preparation.

5082010.trustfund: TF035408-INDIA - RENEWABLE ENERGY, POWER PROJECTS,TF033649-INDIA - ENERGY,TF031967-INDIA - ENERGY,TF031470-INDIA - ENERGY,TF021251-PHRD-JAPANESE CTF (USD ACCOUNT),TF028100-CANADIAN CONSULTANT TRUST FUND (AR)

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the project is to
            improve power supply and operating efficiency in the
            Maharashtra State Electricity Board (MESB) and in the
            Western Region power system. The project comprises the
            following components: (i) construction of a 1000 MW
            fourth-stage of the Koyna hydroelectric power plant; (ii)
            inspection and repairs -as needed- to the existing Koyna
            dam; (iii) supply and erection of equipment and material for
            MESB's five year transmission and distribution
            investment program, and strengthening of MESB's
            capabilities for planning of distribution systems; (iv)
            implementation of plans to strengthen MESB's finances,
            management, and operations; and (v) consultancy and training
            services, as well as computer hardware and software required
            to implement the project.
